IRI.description: Stands for Internationalized Resource Identifier which is an internet protocol standard that builds on the URI protocol, extending the set of permitted characters to include Unicode/ISO 10646.
IRI.name: IRI

abstractionLevel.description: Extent of simplification of physical, spatial, or temporal details or attributes in the study of objects or systems.
abstractionLevel.name: Abstraction level

accessibility.description: Level to which something is accessible to someone or something.
accessibility.name: Accessibility

acknowledgement.description: Offical declaration or avowal of appreciation of an act or achievement.
acknowledgement.name: Acknowledgement

addExistingTerminology.description: Reference to an existing terminology (distinct class to group related terms).
addExistingTerminology.name: Add existing terminology

additionalRemarks.description: Mention of what deserves additional attention or notice.
additionalRemarks.name: Additional remarks

affiliation.description: Declaration of a person being closely associated to an organization.
affiliation.name: Affiliation

age.description: Time of life or existence at which some particular qualification, capacity or event arises.
age.name: Age

ageCategory.description: Distinct life cycle class that is defined by a similar age or age range (developmental stage) within a group of individual beings.
ageCategory.name: Age category

algorithm.description: Procedure for solving a mathematical problem in a finite number of steps. Can involve repetition of an operation.
algorithm.name: Algorithm

anatomicalAxesOrientation.description: Relation between reference planes used in anatomy and mathematics.
anatomicalAxesOrientation.name: Anatomical axes orientation

anatomicalEntity.description: Physical component of a body, organ, or tissue.
anatomicalEntity.name: Anatomical entity

annotationSet.description: Collection of notes or markings, each added by way of comment or explanation.
annotationSet.name: Annotation set

applicationCategory.description: Distinct class that groups software programs which perform a similar task or set of tasks.
applicationCategory.name: Application category

author.description: Creator of a literary or creative work, as well as a dataset publication.
author.name: Author

awardNumber.description: Machine-readable identifier for a benefit that is conferred or bestowed on the basis of merit or need.
awardNumber.name: Award number

awardTitle.description: Human-readable identifier for a benefit that is conferred or bestowed on the basis of merit or need.
awardTitle.name: Award title

axesOrigin.description: Special point in a coordinate system used as a fixed point of reference for the geometry of the surrounding space.
axesOrigin.name: Axes origin

behavioralTask.description: Specific set of defined activities (or their absence) that should be performed (or avoided) by a subject.
behavioralTask.name: Behavioral task

bestViewPoint.description: Coordinate point from which you get the best view of something.
bestViewPoint.name: Best view point

biologicalSex.description: Differentiation of individuals of most species (animals and plants) based on the type of gametes they produce.
biologicalSex.name: Biological sex

contactInformation.description: Any available way used to contact a person or business (e.g., address, phone number, email address, etc.).
contactInformation.name: Contact information

contributionType.description: Distinct class of what was given or supplied as a part or share.
contributionType.name: Contribution type

contributor.description: Legal person that gave or supplied something as a part or share.
contributor.name: Contributor

coordinatePoint.description: Pair or triplet of numbers defining the position in a particular two- or three dimensional plane or space.
coordinatePoint.name: Coordinate point

coordinateSpace.description: Two or three dimensional geometric setting.
coordinateSpace.name: Coordinate space

coordinates.description: Pair or triplet of numbers defining a location in a given coordinate space.
coordinates.name: Coordinates

coordinator.description: Legal person who organizes the collaborative work of people or groups.
coordinator.name: Coordinator

copyright.description: Exclusive and assignable legal right of an originator to reproduce, publish, sell, or distribute the matter and form of a creative work for a defined time period.
copyright.name: Copyright

criteria.description: Aspects or standards on which a judgement or decision is based.
criteria.name: Criteria

criteriaQualityType.description: Distinct class that defines how the judgement or decision was made for a particular criteria.
criteriaQualityType.name: Criteria quality type

custodian.description: Legal person entrusted with guarding and maintaining property or records.
custodian.name: Custodian

defaultImage.description: Two or three dimensional image that particluarly represents a specific coordinate space.
defaultImage.name: Default image

definedIn.description: Reference to a file instance in which something is stored.
definedIn.name: Defined in

definition.description: Short, but precise statement of the meaning of a word, word group, sign or a symbol.
definition.name: Definition

description.description: Longer statement or account giving the characteristics of someone or something.
description.name: Description

developer.description: Legal person that creates or improves products or services (e.g., software, applications, etc.).
developer.name: Developer

device.description: Piece of equipment or mechanism (hardware) designed to serve a special purpose or perform a special function.
device.name: Device

digest.description: Summation or condensation of a body of information.
digest.name: Digest

digitalIdentifier.description: Digital handle to identify objects or legal persons.
digitalIdentifier.name: Digital identifier

electrodeContact.description: Not shielded part of a conductor that is used to establish electrical contact with a nonmetallic part of a circuit.
electrodeContact.name: Electrode contact

electrodes.description: Elements in a semiconductor device that emits or collects electrons or holes or controls their movements.
electrodes.name: Electrodes

email.description: Address to which or from which an electronic mail can be sent.
email.name: Email

endDate.description: Date in the Gregorian calendar at which something terminates in time.
endDate.name: End date

ethicsAssessment.description: Judgment about the applied principles of conduct governing an individual or a group.
ethicsAssessment.name: Ethics assessment

familyName.description: Name borne in common by members of a family.
familyName.name: Family name

feature.description: Structure, form, or appearance that characterizes something or someone.
feature.name: Feature

fileExtension.description: String of characters attached as suffix to the names of files of a particular format.
fileExtension.name: File extension

format.description: Method of digitally organizing and structuring data or information.
format.name: Format

fullDocumentation.description: Non-abridged instructions, comments, and information for using a particular product.
fullDocumentation.name: Full documentation

fullName.description: Whole, non-abbreviated name of something or somebody.
fullName.name: Full name

funder.description: Legal person that provides money for a particular purpose.
funder.name: Funder

funding.description: Money provided by a legal person for a particular purpose.
funding.name: Funding

genotype.description: Genetic constitution of an individual or group.
genotype.name: Genotype

givenName.description: Name given to a person, including all potential middle names, but excluding the family name.
givenName.name: Given name

groupedBy.description: Reference to the aspect used to group something.
groupedBy.name: Grouped by

handedness.description: Degree to which an organism prefers one hand or foot over the other hand or foot during the performance of a task.
handedness.name: Handedness

hasComponent.description: Reference to an element of a collection.
hasComponent.name: Has component

hasParent.description: Reference to a parent object or legal person.
hasParent.name: Has parent

hasVersion.description: Reference to variants of an original.
hasVersion.name: Has version

hash.description: Term used for the process of converting any data into a single value. Often also directly refers to the resulting single value.
hash.name: Hash

holder.description: Legal person in possession of something.
holder.name: Holder

homepage.description: Main website of something or someone.
homepage.name: Homepage

hostedBy.description: Reference to an organization that provides facilities and services for something.
hostedBy.name: Hosted by

howToCite.description: Preferred format for citing a particular object or legal person.
howToCite.name: How to cite

identifier.description: Term or code used to identify something or someone.
identifier.name: Identifier

identifierPattern.description: Format of a term or code used to identify something or someone.
identifierPattern.name: Identifier pattern

identifierSchema.description: Standard for creating a particular identifier for something or someone.
identifierSchema.name: Identifier schema

input.description: Something or someone that is put into or participates in a process or machine.
input.name: Input

inputData.description: Data that is put into a process or machine.
inputData.name: Input data

inputFormat.description: Format of data that is put into a process or machine.
inputFormat.name: Input format

internalIdentifier.description: Term or code that identifies someone or something within a particular product.
internalIdentifier.name: Internal identifier

isAlternativeVersionOf.description: Reference to an original form where the essence was preserved, but presented in an alternative form.
isAlternativeVersionOf.name: Is alternative version of

isNewVersionOf.description: Reference to a previous (potentially outdated) particular form of something.
isNewVersionOf.name: Is new version of

isPartOf.description: Reference to the ensemble of multiple things or beings.
isPartOf.name: Is part of

keyword.description: Significant word or concept that are representative of something or someone.
keyword.name: Keyword

language.description: System of communication (words, their pronunciation, and the methods of combining them) used and understood by a particular community.
language.name: Language

laterality.description: Differentiation between a pair of lateral homologous parts of the body.
laterality.name: Laterality

legalCode.description: Type of legislation that claims to cover the law system (complete or parts) as it existed at the time the code was enacted.
legalCode.name: Legal code

license.description: Grant by a party to another party as an element of an agreement between those parties that permits to do, use, or own something.
license.name: License

modality.description: Classification according to a logical proposition in which something exists, is experienced or expressed.
modality.name: Modality

name.description: Word or phrase that constitutes the distinctive designation of a being or thing.
name.name: Name

namingTerm.description: Word or expression that has a precise meaning within a science, art, profession, or subject.
namingTerm.name: Naming term

nativeUnit.description: Determinate quantity used in the original measurement.
nativeUnit.name: Native unit

ontologyIdentifier.description: Term or code used to identify something or someone registered within a particular ontology.
ontologyIdentifier.name: Ontology identifier

operatingSystem.description: Software that controls the operation of a computer and directs the processing of programs.
operatingSystem.name: Operating system

organization.description: Legally accountable, administrative and functional structure.
organization.name: Organization

origin.description: Source at which something begins or rises, or from which something derives.
origin.name: Origin

otherAnatomicalRelation.description: Reference to a related anatomical structure.
otherAnatomicalRelation.name: Other anatomical relation

otherContribution.description: Giving or supplying of something (such as money or time) as a part or share other than what is covered elsewhere.
otherContribution.name: Other contribution

output.description: Something or someone that comes out of, is delivered or produced by a process or machine.
output.name: Output

outputData.description: Data that comes out of, is delivered or produced by a process or machine.
outputData.name: Output data

outputFormat.description: Format of data that comes out of, is delivered or produced by a process or machine.
outputFormat.name: Output format

parameter.description: Digital or physical property determining a particular function, characteristic or behavior of something.
parameter.name: Parameter

parameterSet.description: Manner, position, or direction in which digital or physical properties are set to determine a particular function, characteristics or behavior of something.
parameterSet.name: Parameter set

pathology.description: Structural and functional deviation from the normal that constitutes a disease or characterizes a particular disease.
pathology.name: Pathology

patternOfFilenames.description: Reliable sample / structure of characters valid for all names in a particular collection of files.
patternOfFilenames.name: Pattern of filenames

phenotype.description: Physical expression of one or more genes of an organism.
phenotype.name: Phenotype

preparationType.description: Distinct class of actions or processes that make something ready for use or service.
preparationType.name: Preparation type

programmingLanguage.description: Distinct set of instructions for computer programs in order to produce various kinds of output.
programmingLanguage.name: Programming language

protocol.description: Plan that describes the process of a scientific or medical experiment, treatment, or procedure.
protocol.name: Protocol

qualitativeOverlap.description: Semantic characterization of how much two things occupy the same space.
qualitativeOverlap.name: Qualitative overlap

quantitativeOverlap.description: Numerical characterization of how much two things occupy the same space.
quantitativeOverlap.name: Quantitative overlap

quantity.description: Total amount or number of things or beings.
quantity.name: Quantity

relatedAtlasTerm.description: Reference to a related naming term of an anatomical structure that is defined in a particular brain atlas.
relatedAtlasTerm.name: Related atlas term

relatedMediaType.description: Reference to an official two-part identifier for file formats and format contents.
relatedMediaType.name: Related media type

relatedPublication.description: Reference to something that was made available for the general public to see or buy.
relatedPublication.name: Related publication

relatedRecording.description: Reference to the written, stored evidence of something.
relatedRecording.name: Related recording

relatedStimulation.description: Reference to the written, stored function used as a physiological stimulus.
relatedStimulation.name: Related stimulation

releaseDate.description: Fixed date on which a product is due to become or was made available for the general public to see or buy
releaseDate.name: Release date

relevantFor.description: Reference to what or whom something or someone bears siginificance.
relevantFor.name: Relevant for

repository.description: Place, room, or container where something is deposited or stored.
repository.name: Repository

requirement.description: Something essential to the existence, occurrence or function of something else.
requirement.name: Requirement

semanticallyAnchoredTo.description: Reference to a related anatomical structure without providing a quantitative proof of the claimed relation.
semanticallyAnchoredTo.name: Semantically anchored to

serializationFormat.description: Form in which a particular data structure or object state is translated to for storage.
serializationFormat.name: Serialization format

shortName.description: Shortened or fully abbreviated name of something or somebody.
shortName.name: Short name

specialUsageRole.description: Particular function of something when it is used.
specialUsageRole.name: Special usage role

species.description: Category of biological classification comprising related organisms or populations potentially capable of interbreeding, and being designated by a binomial that consists of the name of a genus followed by a Latin or latinized uncapitalized noun or adjective.
species.name: Species

specification.description: Detailed and precise presentation of, or proposal for something.
specification.name: Specification

specificationFormat.description: Form in which a particular data structure or object state is specified in.
specificationFormat.name: Specification format

startDate.description: Date in the Gregorian calendar at which something begins in time
startDate.name: Start date

storageSize.description: Quantitative value defining how much disk space is used by an object on a computer system.
storageSize.name: Storage size

strain.description: Group of presumed common ancestry with physiological but usually not morphological distinctions.
strain.name: Strain

studiedState.description: Reference to a point in time at which something or someone was studied in a particular mode or condition.
studiedState.name: Studied state

studyTarget.description: Structure or function that was targeted within a study.
studyTarget.name: Study target

suggestNewTerminology.description: Proposal of a new distinct class to group related terms.
suggestNewTerminology.name: Suggest new terminology

supportChannel.description: Way of communication used to interact with users or customers.
supportChannel.name: Support channel

synonym.description: Words or expressions used in the same language that have the same or nearly the same meaning in some or all senses.
synonym.name: Synonym

technique.description: Method of accomplishing a desired aim.
technique.name: Technique

terminology.description: Nomenclature for a particular field of study.
terminology.name: Terminology

type.description: Distinct class to which a group of entities or concepts with similar characteristics or attributes belong to.
type.name: Type

typeOfUncertainty.description: Distinct technique used to quanitify the uncertainty of a measurement.
typeOfUncertainty.name: Type of uncertainty

uncertainty.description: Quanitative value range defining the uncertainty of a measurement.
uncertainty.name: Uncertainty

unit.description: Determinate quantity adopted as a standard of measurement.
unit.name: Unit

versionIdentifier.description: Term or code used to identify the version of something.
versionIdentifier.name: Version identifier

versionInnovation.description: Documentation on what changed in comparison to a previously published form of something.
versionInnovation.name: Version innovation

visualizedIn.description: Reference to an image in which something is visible.
visualizedIn.name: Visualized in

voxelSize.description: Extent of the discrete elements comprising a three-dimensional entity.
voxelSize.name: Voxel size

webpage.description: Hypertext document (block of information) found on the World Wide Web.
webpage.name: Webpage

weight.description: Amount that a thing or being weighs.
weight.name: Weight

year.description: Cycle in the Gregorian calendar specified by a number and comprised of 365 or 366 days divided into 12 months beginning with January and ending with December.
year.name: Year
